stem: Given question: James had trouble learning the French language because he never had any what to it? and answer: exposure, explain why in
no_more_50_words: Inexperience with a language comes from lack of exposure to it, e.g., through a class or from living in a contry where the language is widely spoken. So, it might be difficult to learn French without being exposed to it (by studying, or living in a French-speaking country).
50_to_100_words: Exposure refers to the amount of time and experience someone has with a particular language or subject. In this case, it means that James did not have enough opportunities to hear or use the French language in order to become proficient in it. Without exposure, it can be difficult to acquire new vocabulary, grammar, and comprehension skills. Additionally, lack of exposure can make it harder to retain and recall what you've learned, and it can make it feel more difficult to pick up new information. So having lack of exposure is the main reason he is having trouble learning the French language.
